title: Four men arrested after a brawl at a wedding in western Sydney and two police officers are injured
text:
Four men have been arrested and two police officers were taken to hospital after a brawl at a wedding in western Sydney.

The melee broke out during the wedding reception at 'The Highline Venue' on Chapel Road in Bankstown at about 7pm on Saturday night.

Police were called to the venue after reports a group of men were fighting.

Four men have been arrested and two police officers were taken to hospital after a brawl at a wedding in western Sydney

Officers tried to break up the fight between the men, who allegedly became aggressive toward the police.

One of the men was tasered and arrested after he allegedly approached an officer.

The melee broke out during the wedding reception at 'The Highline Venue' on Chapel Road in Bankstown at about 7pm on Saturday night

A senior constable was treated in hospital for a dislocated shoulder and another was treated for capsicum spray contamination.

The four men were charged with assault, assault police and affray.

The four men were granted conditional bail to appear at Bankstown Local Court on Wednesday 30 October 2019.
description: The melee broke out during the wedding reception at 'The Highline Venue' on Chapel Road in Bankstown at about 7pm on Saturday night.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
